definition: respectfully yours (in closing a letter)
cautious/careful/solemnly/sincerely (formal)
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
to respectfully inform (used at the beginning or end of letters)
respectful closing to a letter
kowtow
to present respectfully/with (sb's) compliments/complimentary
to lie prostrate/to prostrate oneself (in veneration)
to offer one's congratulations (formal)
Dear Sirs/To Whom It May Concern
to offer humbly (written at the end of letter from sb of lower status to higher status)/your humble servant
(hon.) your distinguished thoughts/Thank you (for your esteemed contribution to our discussion).
peace all year round (old letter closing)
(honorific) revered news/the most valuable information (in your recent letter, book etc)/Thank you for your letter.
variant of 恭維|恭维[gong1 wei5]
profound love, generous friendship (idiom)
a letter of condolence
(honorific written address to younger man) My dear young friend
would like to invite (epistolary style)
